questions.question:
Except for ultra-light aeroplanes and balloons, which documents shall be carried on board when flying a radio equipped Canadian privately registered aircraft? Items A, B and
A. Flight Authority (Certificate of Airworthiness or Flight Permit).
B. Certificate of Registration.
C. Technical Records.
D. Crew licenses.
E. Aircraft Flight Manual or equivalent document.
F. Type certificate.
G. Aircraft journey log book, where it is not planned that the aircraft will land and shutdown at any location other than the point of departure.
H. Proof of liability insurance.
Taking into account seasonal climatic variations and geographical area, private aeroplanes and helicopters flying VFR 25 NM or more from an aerodrome or operating base may require

answers.2: a functioning radio capable of two-way radio communication.
answers.3: the aircraft be multi-engined when passengers are carried.

references: CARs 602.61 - Survival Equipment - Flights Over Land

questions.question: A serviceable landing light is required equipment on aircraft

answers.2: carrying passengers at night except private aircraft under 5,700 kg.
answers.4: taking off or landing at night.

questions.question: Unless oxygen and oxygen masks as specified in CARs are readily available, no person shall fly unpressurized aircraft above

No person shall fly an unpressurized aircraft for more than . . . . . at an altitude between 10,000 and 13,000 feet ASL unless there is readily available to each flight crew member, an oxygen mask and a supply of oxygen.
What safety equipment must be available to each person on board a single-engine aircraft which is taking off from or landing on water?
references: CARs 602.62 - Life Preservers and Flotation Devices
CARs 602.63 - Life Rafts and Survival Equipment

No pilot shall take off from or land at an aerodrome at night unless the

answers.1: aircraft is equipped with a functioning two-way radio.
answers.2: aircraft is equipped with a functioning landing light or landing lights.
answers.3: aerodrome is lighted as prescribed by the Minister.
answers.4: pilot has completed 3 night landings in the previous 90 days.

questions.question: The CARs define an infant passenger as a person

answers.3: weighing less than 50 lb (22.7 kg) and under 5 years of age.

questions.question: When the PIC directs that safety belts be fastened, an infant passenger for which no child restraint system is provided shall be

answers.1: fastened securely in a seat by means of a safety belt.
answers.2: held securely in the arms of the responsible an adult person whose safety belt shall be fastened.
answers.3: held securely in the arms of the responsible person and a safety belt shall be fastened about both.
answers.4: secured by any one of the above methods.

references: CARs 605.25 - Entering or Leaving an Aircraft in Flight
